title: The Million Dollar One Point Slam: A Unique Tennis Competition
summary: The Million Dollar One Point Slam is a special tennis event held in Melbourne, Australia, just before the Australian Open. It features 48 competitors, including 24 top professional players such as world number one Carlos Alcaraz and women's number two Iga Swiatek, alongside 24 amateur participants. The amateurs qualify through state championship rounds across Australia or as wildcards, which include celebrities like Taiwanese singer Jay Chou. Each match consists of a single point, with the server determined by a game of rock, paper, scissors. The knockout tournament progresses through rounds, culminating in a final at the 14,800-seat Rod Laver Arena. The winner receives one million Australian dollars in prize money, offering amateurs a rare opportunity to compete against elite athletes. Notable absences include Aryna Sabalenka and Madison Keys, but many top-ranked players are confirmed. This event blends entertainment and sport, highlighting inclusivity and quick-paced competition.
